body: Read your labels people! After researching they all say not to take more than 80 mg a day of this stuff so why do so many show 540 mg for each tablet and sold that way?? First day I took two pills as the packing said 2-3 per day but then read taking more than 900 mg a day is an overdose! So from that point on only take 1 pill. Also not to take this for more than 6 mths! Also not to take if you are taking high blood pressure pills or are pregnant. So read your labels and research!! The product does work, after 1st two pills I felt a dramatic difference already, did not have to wait 6 wks or longer as most people mention, so it's worth its weight in gold!
title: READ YOUR LABELS

body: I suffer from severe PMDD and was at my wits end until I read about this on a Native American Herbal website. This has almost completely gotten rid of my PMDD symptoms. I do take this in conjunction with Bee Pollen Complex. I take 1 bee pollen and 2 of the black cohosh daily. I cant tell you what a difference this had made in my life. Usually 2 weeks before my period, I would be uncontrollable. I would not only have sever bloating, and night sweats & insomnia, but the worst was I had the most irrational thoughts and feelings. Feelings that were unfounded about my marriage and life in general. Scary thoughts.This, since I started taking it in February, has gotten rid of 95% of these issues. If you are like me and you need relief, buy this!!! Do not hesitate.  I will update if anything changes but, I am hopeful I have found a "cure" without needing prescriptions.

body: I have been taking Black Cohosh Root 540 mg for over 10 years and can't do without it. It takes a little bit of time to take effect, but the trick is taking enough to find what works for you.  I have experienced no side effects from taking Black Cohosh Root.

body: This worked better than expected. I am 47 and had a hysterectomy 6 months ago. Although I kept my ovaries,  I was told I could go into early menopause or have hormone issues. After about 4 months it hit me. I was having hot flashes 80 percent of the time both night and day. Not painful of course but quite bothersome feeling so hot all the time! I researched online natural remedies and read good reviews about this as well as taking Vitamin E in natural oil form not man made. Within 1 day my symptoms were greatly improved, they had gone down to maybe 2 or 3 a day for the first 2 weeks. I was taking 2 or 3 a day depending if I remembered.  Then one day I noticed I had a few red bumps on my lower stomach area. Looked like large mosquito bites. The next day they had spread to my butt, couple on arms and legs and back.  I had a similar reaction to St Johns Wort. I was torn because I loved hoe they took away my hot flashes but these red bumps were awful as well. They didn't hurt or itch but looked terrible. I stopped taking the pills and the rash went away and thank God my hot flashes have not returned.  Its been 3 weeks.  I can only assume it was enough to kick me back into a good hormone balance and then they built up in my system and caused the break out.  Of course the next time I experience hot flashes i will repeat this process.
title: Worked in 1 day for my hot flashes.

body: I'm giving this a 4☆, for now, based upon 4 weeks use to treat premenopausal hotflashes. I realize everyone's chemistry is different, but it's probably worth reporting my experience. First and foremost, I completely support other posters that claim "it takes a while" to notice improvement. My hotflashes were practically debilitating; around the clock, hourly and intense. It was tough to keep the faith and press-on without immediate relief. I highly recommend sticking with it! It took about 2 weeks of 3 capsules per day. Admittedly, I did experience some constipation at first, and used a gentle softener to counteract that side effect.  As of week 3, I was able to reducemy intake to 2 capsules daily, which has eliminated that one side-effect. Now, in week 4, I am taking 2 capsules daily with breakfast, and hotflashes are almost completely gone. I do have an occasional break-through flash, but they're less than one or two per week! MUCH improved. I can sleep again! If I experience a relapse with time, I will update accordingly.  For now, I highly recommend this natural alternative.

body: This worked better than expected. I am 47 and had a hysterectomy 6 months ago. Although I kept my ovaries,  I was told I could go into early menopause or have hormone issues. After about 4 months it hit me. I was having hot flashes 80 percent of the time both night and day. Not painful of course but quite bothersome feeling so hot all the time! I researched online natural remedies and read good reviews about this as well as taking Vitamin E in natural oil form not man made. Within 1 day my symptoms were greatly improved, they had gone down to maybe 2 or 3 a day for the first 2 weeks. I was taking 2 or 3 a day depending if I remembered.  Then one day I noticed I had a few red bumps on my lower stomach area. Looked like large mosquito bites. The next day they had spread to my butt, couple on arms and legs and back.  I had a similar reaction to St Johns Wort. I was torn because I loved hoe they took away my hot flashes but these red bumps were awful as well. They didn't hurt or itch but looked terrible. I stopped taking the pills and the rash went away and thank God my hot flashes have not returned.  Its been 3 weeks.  I can only assume it was enough to kick me back into a good hormone balance and then they built up in my system and caused the break out.  Of course the next time I experience hot flashes i will repeat this process.
title: Worked in 1 day for my hot flashes.

body: I started taking Black Cohosh to help out with hot flashes from entering menopause. My sister gets terrible hot flashes, my mom has always had terrible ones and I thought I would be doomed to follow suit. When they first started happening, I read about Black Cohosh and figured it was worth a try as I didn't want to take estrogen replacement pills/patches or any soy products. This stuff has been a miracle to me! I take it once a day and have few if any hot flashes any longer (I've been on it for about 9 months). I'll get perhaps a little warm every now and then, but no sweating through my clothes (my old hot flashes even had my fingers break out in a sweat), no night sweats, no feeling like I've been set on fire - all that went away after about 2 weeks on these pills. I also take Vitamin E and Vitamin D each day which I think work in conjunction with the Black Cohosh. I'm on this for good and am happy that my menopausal years have turned out to be not that big of a deal at all!

body: I started taking Black Cohosh to help out with hot flashes from entering menopause. My sister gets terrible hot flashes, my mom has always had terrible ones and I thought I would be doomed to follow suit. When they first started happening, I read about Black Cohosh and figured it was worth a try as I didn't want to take estrogen replacement pills/patches or any soy products. This stuff has been a miracle to me! I take it once a day and have few if any hot flashes any longer (I've been on it for about 9 months). I'll get perhaps a little warm every now and then, but no sweating through my clothes (my old hot flashes even had my fingers break out in a sweat), no night sweats, no feeling like I've been set on fire - all that went away after about 2 weeks on these pills. I also take Vitamin E and Vitamin D each day which I think work in conjunction with the Black Cohosh. I'm on this for good and am happy that my menopausal years have turned out to be not that big of a deal at all!
title: Excellent Help for Menopause Hot Flashes!

Everything I've read about Black Cohosh is that you should not take it for more than 6 months. I'll speak to my doctor at that time and may have to try another supplement.

body: As a 54 year old woman (who has been post-menopausal since April 2013), my gynecologist recommended Black Cohosh because I'd been waking up every night (summer and winter) "overheated" (not quite what I'd call "night sweats", but it was uncomfortable enough to wake me from a deep sleep wanting to crawl into a refrigerator).  From the time I began taking one capsule before bedtime every night, I have slept through the night without incident.  So, either it's a strange  coincidence, or this stuff works.
title: No more waking up hot and bothered

body: I purchased this product to address severe hot flashes. I was having between 5 and 10 significant hot flashes each day. I have only used it for a week or so, and my hot flashes seem to be less often and less severe! I am very happy with the results and hopeful that this trend continues. On a side note, the expiration date on the bottles was more than a year away!
title: Good so far!

body: Worked fine from the day I started.  It didn't take long to start working (within a week) and helping me with night sweats.  I only take it once a day and I no longer wake up sweating.  But if I fail to take it, the night sweats come back, so I really need it daily.  So glad for the great reviews on this product and happy that amazon has a great price for it.  Hopefully amazon will continue to have this product.
title: Worked for night sweats!

body: This practically eliminated my hot flashes and night sweats. I was getting them at least once an hour night and day. I started taking 1 40 MG tablet a day and within a few days I started noticing a difference, then a week later they were dramatically reduced, and now a month later I'm pretty much hot-flash-free. I don't like to take more meds or supplements than really needed, so I switched to taking 1 tablet every other day to see if it mattered, and I get the same result. And I haven't had any side effects either. This is a great alternative to HRT although it can have some side effects for some people, so be sure to read up on it to be sure it's right for you and doesn't interfere with any other medications you're on.
title: and now a month later I'm pretty much hot-flash-free

body: I don't know what I expected taking evening primrose (weirdly I was just drawn by the name and I happen to love the biotin that this brand sells), but I haven't had any acne in the entire month I've been taking this. This is HUGE for me because I've always gotten sweltering zits two weeks out of the month since I was 14 (I have severely hormonal acne). Hell, even my mother gets monthly breakouts to this day, so I always chalked acne (and especially big pores/blackheads) to just being my lot in life. Since taking these, my skin is COMPLETELY clear with not a single bump in sight. In fact, even my pores are smaller. I'm often bare-faced because I work at a gym, and my skin has this photoshopped, rosy tint to it now. I have no idea if evening primrose is even popular for treating acne, but.. this product is a life saver!

body: I started taking these to prevent hormonal breakouts that I'd get around that time of the month. I would typically get one or two blemishes on my chin at most. After a few weeks of taking these, I had full blown cystic acne all over my cheeks and jawline. They were deep, painful blemishes like I'd never seen before. I had switched to Chanel makeup and skincare, so I thought that was to blame. I switched back to all the tried-and-true products that I knew worked for my skin, and I kept taking these religiously hoping that they'd help. Still, the acne persisted. It was so bad that I had to cancel plans and couldn't leave the house, and I was constantly in a horrible mood because I looked so monstrous. Eventually I realized that because the acne was so deep under my skin, it couldn't have been from anything I was putting on my face topically. I started eating really healthy--still nothing. FINALLY I realized that it must be these tablets. As soon as I stopped taking these, all my acne cleared completely in about 3 days. I hope nobody has the same experience as I did, but I figured I needed to share my experience in case anyone else is desperately trying to figure out why they're breaking out.

body: Since there is no feedback here about the biggest side effect of this herb and I had to find out the hard way I am leaving this feedback.  As other websites and herbalists will tell you, the biggest side effect of evening primrose oil is mid-cycle bleeding.  For me, this began instantaneously.  It caused as much bleeding as during your cycle.  It ceased within 24 hours of stopping taking this.  In my opinion, there is no single benefit worth wearing a tampon every single day of the month.  This is not the fault of the maker of this supplement, however, hence the 2 stars.  But I wanted this review to be on Amazon to save someone else the trouble of spending $20 and finding out the hard way.
title: Side Effects Not Worth It

body: First, I'm an actual person that actually bought this product. I've always struggled with horrible period issues, and recently had an issue with an IUD and it really left me with heavy painful periods. Along with that I've really always had horrendous  pms, mood swings, irritability, depression, etc.. 10 days leading up to the start of my period. So I decided after my mom has told me for YEARS to try evening primpose oil, at the end of my rope with my symptoms and not wanting to do any kind of prescription  hormones I said to myself I was just gonna take it and see what happens. I did some research and and figured out what level of GLA I should be looking for and read LOTS of reviews and purchases this product. I take 4 pills a day and that amount is working amazingly. 2 period cycles later it's a whole different ball game.  My boyfriend can't even tell when I'm about to start my period anymore, and frankly before, each month we were on the verge of breaking up sometimes because I would act like a crazy person, and he could tell as soon as my pms started. No more cramps, my periods are lighter and shorter and generally much more pleasant then the horrific emotional bloodbath I had become accustomed to. And the best part of all of this, the wonderful  little side effect I had thought wouldnt work for me, is my acne I've struggled with my entire life (I'm in my 30's) has cleared up significantly.  Does my skin look like a magazine model? No. But, is it 95% better? Yes!!! I hardly wear any foundation or concealer anymore and I've had 4-5 very small pimples in the last 2 months which is basically nothing for me, which has been so amazing. I used to wear A LOT of makeup to cover up my acne which we all know just makes it look worse. It's been incredibly liberating, and believe me if it exist on this planet I've tried it for acne, topical, prescription, herbal, creams, washes, natural, conventional, over the counter, etc.... This has worked the best! Hope this helps anyone looking for something to help for acne or pms...
title: I've always struggled with horrible period issues

The problem with this is (mothers who went through this, I feel for you and you know what I'm about to discuss) that a transverse baby doesn't allow your cervix to ripen properly since the baby's head isn't here to put pressure on you.  Well, someone told me about an old wive's tale about using evening primrose oil to help loosen up the cervix and ripen you for a delivery when you get toward the last couple weeks.  Surely it can't be this simple!  But I had to give it a try.
title: Appeared helpful in prepping me to have a baby

body: I started taking these to prevent hormonal breakouts that I'd get around that time of the month. I would typically get one or two blemishes on my chin at most. After a few weeks of taking these, I had full blown cystic acne all over my cheeks and jawline. They were deep, painful blemishes like I'd never seen before. I had switched to Chanel makeup and skincare, so I thought that was to blame. I switched back to all the tried-and-true products that I knew worked for my skin, and I kept taking these religiously hoping that they'd help. Still, the acne persisted. It was so bad that I had to cancel plans and couldn't leave the house, and I was constantly in a horrible mood because I looked so monstrous. Eventually I realized that because the acne was so deep under my skin, it couldn't have been from anything I was putting on my face topically. I started eating really healthy--still nothing. FINALLY I realized that it must be these tablets. As soon as I stopped taking these, all my acne cleared completely in about 3 days. I hope nobody has the same experience as I did, but I figured I needed to share my experience in case anyone else is desperately trying to figure out why they're breaking out.
title: Caused me TERRIBLE cystic acne

body: As someone who recently went off of birth control, my hormonal chin acne decided to flare up.  Topical solutions have always dried out my skin to the point that I didn't know which was worse - the acne or the flaking skin.  After digging through some research, I decided to give Evening Primrose Oil a try due to its anti-inflammatory and healing properties.  The omega-6 fatty acids present in evening primrose oil can help to regulate hormone levels and cure hormonal acne issues. I purchased Sports Research High Potency Evening Primrose softgels made with 10% GLA from non-GMO cold-pressed oil due to their high ratings.  I'm now on my second bottle and will continue to re-purchase.  My skin looks calmer and certainly less oily.  While I haven't completely kicked my hormonal acne, I notice little flare-ups if I forget to take a supplement!
title: Topical solutions have always dried out my skin to the point that I didn't know which was worse - the acne or the flaking skin

body: I recently purchased Sports Research Evening Primrose Oil.  I liked the fact they were made in the US and had a high potency.  This is the first time I have tried Evening Primrose Oil and have started noticing my skin on my face especially smoothing out and have not gotten the acne I was getting before starting it.  I have only been using it for two weeks.  It seems too soon to be noticing effects from a supplement, yet I have noticed the difference.  I bought the Evening Primrose Oil to help with inflammation from endometriosis to see if I could ease the pain without being on other drugs as well as to help with the acne and PMS symptoms as I had read it can help.  Even though its only been two weeks I have noticed the pain wasn't as bad.  I'm hoping as I go further along with taking the supplement I will continue to notice the helpful effects.  I will have to update in a couple of months.  If nothing else the Evening Primrose Oil from what I have read and in the time I have been taking it only seems to have benefits.
title: Great Product!

body: I take the Evening Primrose Oil 1300 twice daily. It has made a remarkable difference to improve my facial acne. I was experiencing a lot of hard white bumps which my sister in law said were calcium deposits. After about three weeks taking the Evening Primrose I could see significant improvement. Now after taking for several months I do not have them appear at all. I was already taking it when I went for eye check up. The optometrist was surprised I already take it when he recommended Evening Primrose along with fish oil and consuming plenty of leafy greens for maintaining eye health. body: This is the second bottle I have purchased of this product and I really like it and will continue to purchase this. I was recommended Evening Primrose Oil by a naturopath to help with regulating my hormones and period after coming off the Pill and when I was having trouble getting my body to return to normal. After taking these supplements for just over a month, I started getting my period again after not having a regular period in a number of years. I am not sure if the two are directly linked however I am certain it helped. Good price for a great product and I appreciate that it is GMO free, free from artificial ingredients, preservatives etc.
title: Great supplement which helped with 'women's health' problems

body: Evening Primrose Oil (EPO) is a great supplement in women's health, especially those of us suffering with PCOS. I have been getting a double whammy, hitting perimenopause and still dealing with my PCOS symptoms. EPO helps balance progesterone and estrogen. It is recommended to take from CD 1 until ovulation, so you should be taking it about 2 weeks on, 2 weeks off, give or take. It can help with PCOS symptoms like odd hair growth and acne, as well as helping normalize your menstrual cycle. It can also be used safely with several other herbal preparations that are also meant to create hormonal homeostasis.
title: Evening Primrose Oil for PCOS and Menopause

I have only been using it for two weeks.  It seems too soon to be noticing effects from a supplement, yet I have noticed the difference.  I bought the Evening Primrose Oil to help with inflammation from endometriosis to see if I could ease the pain without being on other drugs as well as to help with the acne and PMS symptoms as I had read it can help. body: This is a beautifully packaged product and I'm had amazing results. I've been trying to have a baby for about 3 years now with no success and started looking into different supplements before trying IVF. Evening Primrose was recommended to regulate hormone levels and to help ease PMS symptoms. I started taking this supplement about two weeks before my period was due. Usually the first day of my period I'm in so much pain and I'm irrationally emotional (like I cried like a baby watching Happy Feet when they all started dancing at the end) and the pain worsens until the third day then gradually gets better until it ends on day 7. This first period after starting this supplement was only 4 days long, I had little pain on the second day (but nothing in the usual comparison, and I wasn't irrationally emotional. This is a wonderful supplement to aid with reproductive health and I have my fingers crossed to help me have a baby. I'll update this status in about three months.

My skin stayed clear for about 3 months after quitting the pills, then my hormones went out of control on the right side of my face and my forehead. I attributed it to quitting birth control, which might have thrown my hormones off track. Anyways, I went back on the same birth control pills for about 3 weeks, and to my dismay my acne was actually getting worse!

body: I received a card with my order about a free bottle and I lost it, so I contacted customer service, through their website and through amazon and I was ignored both times. Why include the card at all if you have such poor customer service? Just figured I'd mention that since customer service reflects reputation. As far as the product itself, I noticed immediate improvement of my joint pain with Jarrow formulas EPO but this brand didn't do anything for me at the same doses. In my opinion it's not as high quality. Also, I paid $13 for my bottle and it's since gone up to $17 and stayed there for the past few months. This is not a good value in my opinion. Anyone seeking a high quality, good value  evening primrose should check out Jarrow. I'm in no way affiliated with Jarrow Formulas.

body: Black Cohosh taken with Evening Primrose oil has relieved my hot flashes and night sweats.  I would say that it is important to stick with this for about three months to notice the changes.  One must be patient!  It will not work instantly, but if you hang in there it is worth it.  You may also experience headaches at first, because your hormones are rebalancing themselves.  I talked to my doctor about this combination, and she highly agreed with what I was doing.  She did say that it does not work for everyone, but I would say that maybe women are not staying with it long enough.
title: Relief at last!

body: This review is not for the product but for the seller.  When I purchase the product I was purchasing the 800mg which work great for hot flashes, however I have noticed that the product didn't seem to work this time which was odd since it always worked.  While reading the label i noticed that I received 400mg instead of the 800mg that I originally ordered.  Upon further investigation, when I went to my order it calls for 800 and once I click to reorder the 400 mg does shows up in my cart instead of the 800 mg.  This is deceiving....I am a little disappointed and will try to purchase the product from another vendor and will double check that it is 800 mg and not the 400mg.

body: I am peri menopausal, and took black cohosh to stop my severe hot flashes. After the second bottle, my hot flashes were completely gone! I stopped using it for different reasons including the fear that I would damage my liver as a side effect. My doctor reassured me that would not happen and to begin taking the black cohosh again. I did not take the black cohosh for 8 months and I had no hot flashes...so I know it was still in my system.  When my hot flashes began again I decided to start taking the black cohosh again but this time I'm sticking with the product permanently! After the third and a half bottle was finished, my hot flashes have subsided and are almost completely gone again. I recommend this product to all women that are going through hot flashes. It has changed my life.
title: Cure for Hot Flashes!

It's getting old. Hope they stop soon. I'm tired of it! Buying it online is half the price of the local store. I highly recommend this product.

body: About 6 months ago I started having horrible night sweats and several times during the night I had to pull my covers off and turn my AC on full blast because I felt like I was suffocating. I have been so exhausted and miserable in my own skin and have tried everything I could get my hands on that might help my symptoms. Nothing seemed to help. A week ago I started taking this Black Cohosh (540mgs) which is 500 mgs higher than other brands. I just realized tonight that I have not had a single hot flash in 2 days and I am feeling like myself again. This stuff is amazing and I recommend it for anyone going through menopause. If this continues working like it has, I may even cancel my appointment to get hormone replacement therapy.
